in a way that is careful and avoids risks: The funds are maintained in prudentially regulated banks. It is assumed that the buyer and the seller acted prudentially in relation to the sale.
More examplesFewer examplesThe authorities informed him that his visa had been prudentially revoked.The banks no longer have an incentive to lend prudentially as they are facing very little risk.Like any prudentially motivated parent, he wanted to make the best possible financial provision for his children.
